answers.answer: Every pregnancy is different and symptoms will come and go.  With my daughter I had no symptoms at all with her and tons with my sons.  The only thing I had was tons of mild cramping off and on with her then around 8 weeks the morning sickness set in!  With my sons didn't have that.  As long as you are not spotting or bleeding or in severe pain things should be fine.  Also my friend has graves disease and had 3 successful pregnancies.  She was just monitored a little more closely.  Try not to stress and good luck to u.

question: HI Everyone -I've always posted in the thyroid forum, never here -but I wasn't getting any answers, so I hope it's ok to post here.  Does anyone have experience with thyroid issues and pregnancy?  I have recently been diagnosed with graves disease and am 6 weeks pregnant with my second child.  I had the thyroid problem with my first -just didn't have a name for it then.  Everything I've read and am told, is that I'm at a much higher risk for miscarriage, preeclampsia and stillborn babies.  The reason I'm worried is because with my daughter, I was already SO SICK by now, my boobs were soar, I KNEW I was pregnant.  But with this one? Nothing.  I have some mild lower abdominal cramping on top of it so I'm wondering if I'm going to miscarry?  IS it something that you can "feel" coming?  And when do miscarriages generally occur?  Thanks so much, I'm just kind of a nervous wreck right now.
title: hyperthyroid and Pregnant
